Public Prosecutor, Veni. K. These Crl. MCs are came up for hearing on 24.02.2025 and the court on 28.02.2025 passed the following:- COMMON ORDER 1. These are the five bail applications filed by the petitioners u/s.482 of the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, 2023 (Hereinafter referred as BNSS) for anticipatory bail. 2. Gist _of the averments in the petitions are as follows:- The petitioners in Crl.MC No.277/2025 are the accused Nos.9, 10 and 11 in Crime No.1440/2024; the petitioners in Crl.MC No.278/2025 are the accused Nos.9, 10 and 11 in Crime No.1430/2024; the petitioners in Crl.MC No.285/2025 are the accused Nos.9, 10 and 11 in Crime No.1511/2024; the petitioners in Crl.MC No.287/2025 are the accused Nos.9, 10 and 11 in Crime No.1514/2024 of Fort Police Station of the offences punishable u/ss.406 and 420 r/w 34 of IPC. The petitioners in Crl.MC No.286/2025 are the accused Nos.5, 6 and 7 in Crime No.1070/2024 of Medical College Police Station of the Cri. MC, Nos,.277/2025,278/2025,285/2025,286/2025,287/2025 6 offences punishable u/ss.406 and 420 r/w 34 of IPC. The petitioners are ready to abide by any condition and they may be enlarged on bail. 3. Crux of the averments in prosecution case in Crime No.1440/2024 is summarized for Crl.MCG No.277/2025 as _follows:- The accused Nos. 1 to 12, who are none other than the President, Secretary and Board Members of Thiruvithamcore Co-operative Society Limited T.No.1530 committed criminal breach of trust and misappropriation of huge funds and caused wrongful loss to the complainant. On making the complainant believe that they would provide attractive interests in the co-operative society, the accused canvassed the complainant to deposit money and accordingly, a total amount of Rs.9,48,243/- was deposited in the society as Cash Certificate Scheme, FD Account and SB Account of complainant on several days from 12.04.2023 onwards in the said society. Since the receipt of the deposits, the accused neither returned the principal nor its interest accrued in the said deposit after 10.03.2024. Hence, the accused misappropriated the funds to cause wrongful loss to the complainant by way of failing to return the deposit and interest. Hence, the accused are alleged to have committed the offences punishable u/ss. 406 and 420 r/w 34 of IPC. 4. Crux of the averments in prosecution case in Crime No.1430/2024 is summarized for Crl.MC No.278/2025 as _follows:- Ci. MC. Nos.277/2025,278/2025,285/2025,286/2025,287/2025 7 The accused Nos. 1 to 12, who are none other than the President, Secretary and Board Members of Thiruvithamcore Co-operative Society Limited T.No.1530 committed criminal breach of trust and misappropriation of huge funds and caused wrongful loss to the complainant. On making the complainant believe that they would provide attractive interests in the co-operative society, the accused canvassed the complainant to deposit money and accordingly, a total amount of Rs.3,56,100/- was deposited in the FD Account and SB Account of complainant on several days from 21.10.2022 onwards in the said society. Since the receipt of the deposits, the accused neither returned the principal nor its interest accrued in the said deposit after 17/08/2024. Hence, the accused misappropriated the funds to cause wrongful loss to the complainant by way of failing to return the deposit and interest. Hence, the accused are alleged to have committed the offences punishable u/ss. 406 and 420 r/w 34 of IPC. 5. Crux of the averments in prosecution case in Crime No.1511/2024 is summarized for Crl.MC No.285/2025 as _ follows:- The accused Nos. 1 to 12, who are none other than the President, Secretary and Board Members of Thiruvithamcore Co-operative Society Limited T.No.1530 committed criminal breach of trust and misappropriation of huge funds and caused wrongful loss to the complainant. On making the complainant believe that they would Ci. MC. Nos.277/2025,278/2025,285/2025,286/2025,287/2025 8 provide attractive interests in the co-operative society, the accused canvassed the complainant to deposit money and accordingly, a total amount of Rs.77,00,133/- was deposited in the FD Account and SB Account of complainant on several days from 21.08.2010 onwards in the said society. Since the receipt of the deposits, the accused neither returned the principal nor its interest accrued in the said deposit after 28/07/2023. Hence, the accused misappropriated the funds to cause wrongful loss to the complainant by way of failing to return the deposit and interest. | Hence, the accused are alleged to have committed the offences punishable w/ss. 406 and 420 r/w 34 of IPC. 6. Crux of the averments in prosecution case in Crime No.1514/2024 is summarized for Crl.MC No.287/2025 as follows:- The accused Nos. 1 to 12, who are none other than the President, Secretary and Board Members of Thiruvithamcore Co-operative Society Limited T.No.1530 committed criminal breach of trust and misappropriation of huge funds and caused wrongful loss to the complainant. On making the complainant believe that they would provide attractive interests in the co-operative society, the accused canvassed the complainant to deposit money and accordingly, a total amount of Rs.7,00,000/- stands deposited in two FD Accounts in the name of complainants mother and son in the said society. Since the receipt of the deposits, the accused neither returned the Cri. MC. Nos.277/2025,278/2025,285/2025,286/2025,287/2025 9 principal nor its interest accrued in the said deposit. Hence, the accused misappropriated the funds to cause a wrongful loss to the complainant by way of failing to return the deposit and interest. Hence, the accused are alleged to have committed the offences punishable u/s. 406 and 420 r/w 34 of IPC. 7. Crux of the averments in prosecution case in Crime No.1070/2024 is summarized for Crl.MC No.286/2025 as follows:- The accused Nos. 1 to 12 who are respectively the President, Secretary and Board Member of Thiruvithamcore Co-operative Society Limited T.No.1530 committed criminal breach of trust and misappropriation of huge funds and caused wrongful loss to the complainant. On making the complainant believe that they would provided attractive interests in the co-operative society, the accused canvassed the complainant to deposit money and accordingly, an amount of Rs.3,50,000/ was deposited on 18/05/2023 vide FD Receipt No.757/2023 in the said society. Since the receipt of the deposits, the accused neither returned the principal nor its interest accrued in the said deposit after June, 2024. Hence, the accused misappropriated the funds to cause a wrongful loss to the complainant by way of failing to return the deposit and interest. Hence, the accused are alleged to have committed the offences punishable w/ss.406 and 420 r/w 34 of IPC. 8. Both sides are heard and they would urge in tune with those Ci. MC. Nos.277/2025,278/2025,285/2025,286/2025,287/2025 10 contentions in the bail applications and the prosecution cases respectively. The learned Public Prosecutor submitted that the concerned police station approached the higher police officials for transferring the investigation to State Crime Branch and therefore, any detailed investigation was not conducted into the allegations levelled in the various financial frauds alleged in the prosecution cases. The State Crime Branch has now taken over the investigation. 9. The learned prosecutor produced the reports of the Deputy Superintendent of Police, Crime Branch Economic Offences Wing, Thiruvananthapuram Unit to oppose the bail applications. 10. Having perused the reports of the Deputy Superintendent of Police, Crime Branch and after hearing the learned counsel for the petitioners and Public Prosecutor, it is revealed that a more or less similar allegations are levelled against the petitioners in all the cases and they are primafacie punishable uw/ss 406 and 420 r/w 34 of IPC. 11. It is informed that there are no materials in the CD as the SHO/IO did not conduct any detailed investigation in the past on the reason of awaiting Government orders pertaining to transfer the investigation to State Crime Branch due to the pendency of more than 100 similar FIRs. In short, there is no effective investigation by the S.H.O of two police stations into the allegations levelled against the petitioners to probe their exact role in the alleged misappropriation. Details of the criminal cases against the accused Crl. MC, Nos.277/2025,278/2025,285/2025,286/2025,287/2025 11 stands narrated in column No. 16 of the police reports. Having gone through the police reports, copy of FIR and FIS, there is no specific allegation about the siphoning of funds of the society for own use of the office bearers. Any report of the Registrar or Joint Registrar of the Co-operative Societies to find out any _ instances of misappropriation is not forming part of the police reports. Any inspection reports of any higher officials of the Co-operative Department is not forming part of the police report. Moreover, the allegations against the accused ought to reveal that the non-payment of the deposit money in the society is the dispute between the parties. Nature and gravity of the offences alleged against the petitioners ought to reveal that the same is not sufficient enough to place the petitioners under custody and provide a_ custodial interrogation. Having heard both sides and on perusal of the records, I do hold that the discretion of pre-arrest bail can be exercised in favour of the petitioners subject to conditions. Apart from that, the limited interrogation of the petitioners as contemplated under the dictum of the Honble Supreme Court in Sushila Agarwal v. State (NCT of Delhi), 2020 SCC Online SC 98, is sufficient to the facts of the case. 12. As far as a court considering a pre-arrest bail application is concerned, the dictum of the Honble Supreme Court in AIR 1980 SC 1632, Gurubaksh Singh Sibbia_ and Another V. _State of Punjab holds Ci. MC. Nos.277/2025,278/2025,285/2025,286/2025,287/2025 12 the legal position that appropriate conditions can be imposed under sub section 2 of S.438 of CrPC so as to ensure an uninterrupted investigation and the court can even incorporate conditions that in the event of the police, making out a case of a likely discovery u/s.27 of Evidence Act, the person who is granted with an anticipatory bail can be taken into police custody for facilitating such discovery. 13. On applying the above dictum to the facts of the case and after carefully hearing the learned counsel for the petitioners and public prosecutor, it is just and proper to allow the applications to grant pre-arrest bail to the petitioners on conditions to co-operate with the investigation. 14. In the result, these Criminal MCs are allowed subject to the conditions as follows:- (i) The petitioners/accused Nos.9, 10 & 11 in Crl.MC No.277/2025(Crime No.1440/2024); petitioners/accused Nos.9, 10 & 11 in Crl.MC No.278/2025(Crime No.1430/2024); petitioners/accused Nos.9, 10 & 11 in Crl.MC No.285/2025 (Crime No.1511/2024); petitioners/accused Nos.9, 10 & 11 in Crl.MC No.287/2025(Crime No.1514/2024) of Fort Police Station and petitioners/accused Nos.5, 6 & 7 in Crl.MC No.286/2025(Crime No.1070/2024) of Medical College police Ci. MC. Nos.277/2025,278/2025,285/2025,286/2025,287/2025 13 shall surrender and appear before the Investigating Officer on 03.03.2025 at 9.00 am and subject themselves for interrogation from 09.00 am to 06.00 pm from 03.03.2025 to 04.03.2025, if required by the Investigating Officer. (ii) The petitioners shall be deemed to be under the limited custody of the Investigating Officer during the aforesaid period for facilitating the requirements of investigation. (iii) The petitioners shall further co-operate with the Investigating Officer for facilitating the investigation as and when required by the Investigating Officer. (iv) The petitioners shall not commit any similar offence while on bail. (v) The petitioners shall not do any acts to directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any witnesses or any other persons acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade the said witness or tamper with the evidence. Crl. MC. Nos.277/2025,278/2025,285/2025,286/2025,287/2025 14 (vi) In compliance with conditions No.(i) to (iii), the Investigating Officer is at liberty to interrogate the petitioners, take appropriate steps for recovery as provided under law and the following conditions will not stand as an embargo in the investigation and interrogation. (vii) On completion of such steps required for interrogation and investigation and in the event of any arrest, the petitioners shall be released on bail on executing separate bail bonds for a sum of Rs.1,00,000/- (Rupees One Lakh only) each together with two solvent sureties for the like sum in all the five cases. (viii) The petitioners shall not leave the country without the permission of the jurisdictional court and in compliance, produce the passport before the Jurisdictional Magistrate. In case, the petitioners does not have any passport, file an affidavit in this regard before the learned Magistrate. (ix) In case of any violation of bail conditions or change in circumstances, the Investigating Officer or the petitioners in the above bail applications are at liberty to approach the Jurisdictional Magistrate/Court and seek for Crl. MC, Nos.277/2025,278/2025,285/2025,286/2025,287/2025 15 modification/cancellation of bail conditions and the said Magistrate is authorised to pass appropriate orders as per law.
